summary: Based on the provided documents, there is no mention of Edward M. Evans. The documents primarily concern payroll records and notifications related to staff members of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). These records include information about individuals like Louis Parisi, Dominick K. Giangrasso, and Ernestine G. Johnson, as well as notifications regarding the postponement of releasing social security numbers from HSCA staff payroll records. The documents focus on administrative and personnel matters rather than investigative findings or specific individuals involved in the JFK assassination beyond HSCA staff.
significance: Based on the provided documents, Edward M. Evans has no significance in the JFK context.
